sentences.en: A company needed a submarine to submerge into the deep sea.
sentences.cn: 一家公司需要一艘潜水艇潜水至深海.

sentences.en: Alice submerged herself in work to try and forget about Tom.
sentences.cn: 艾丽斯埋头工作，试图忘记汤姆。

sentences.en: At the first sign of danger the submarine will submerge.
sentences.cn: 一有危险迹象,潜艇就会潜入水中.

sentences.en: He can submerge to a depth of about twenty meters.
sentences.cn: 他能潜入约二十米深的水中.

sentences.en: Hippos are unable to submerge in the few remaining water holes.
sentences.cn: 在仅剩的几个水坑里，河马根本无法没入水中。

sentences.en: It will submerge nearby towns and overturn the mountains in its course.
sentences.cn: 它会在途中淹没了城镇,倾覆了山脉.

sentences.en: Or else we would be in a crisis that would submerge the issue.
sentences.cn: 要么,我们就是处于危机之中,这个问题也就不必谈了.
潜水艇的下潜速度非常快.

sentences.en: The excellent diver can submerge as deep as 243 meters to work.
sentences.cn: 这个出色的潜水员可以潜入海下243米的深处工作.

sentences.en: The submarine can submerge very quickly.
sentences.cn: 潜艇能非常迅速地潜入水中.

sentences.en: The submarine had had time to submerge before the warship could approach.
sentences.cn: 潜水艇没等军舰靠近就及时潜入水下了。

sentences.en: The tunnel entrance was submerged by rising sea water.
sentences.cn: 隧道入口被涨起的海水淹没。

sentences.en: The waters were rising about the rock and would soon submerge it.
sentences.cn: 水快涨到跟岩石一样高了，很快就会淹没它。

sentences.en: To go toward the bottom of a body of water ; submerge.
sentences.cn: 潜水:潜入一片水域的底部; 潜入水中.
以动力潜水在力的作用下潜水.

sentences.en: We were not prepared to submerge our doubts about some of the existing trends and procedures.
sentences.cn: 我们不准备掩盖我们对目前某些倾向和程序的怀疑.

words.tran_cn: 能浸入水中的；可潜入水中的
能潜水的；能沉入水中的
潜入水中（submerge的过去分词）；使陷入
浸没（submerse的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tran_en: to make yourself very busy doing something, especially in order to forget about something else
to go under the surface of the water and be completely covered by it
to cover something completely with water or another liquid

trans.tran_cn: 淹没，把…浸入，沉没，下潜，使沉浸
